title: 3 companies to pay $615,000 in NY attorney general investigation over faked net neutrality comments
description: See this is why I send vials of my blood to websites where I make comments. It's not "weird" -- it's proof of identity.

title: An Introduction to the Bun JavaScript Runtime
description: A rival JavaScript runtime contender has entered the battle between Node.js and Deno. In this article, we take a first look at Bun, and the reasons it may tempt you away from your current favorite.

title: Firefox 113 unveils search and picture-in-picture improvements alongside tighter security
description: The Mozilla Foundation has unveiled Firefox 113.0 alongside Firefox ESR 102.11.0, the latest version of its open-source, cross-platform browser.

title: Good managers are also good at what else
Hackers target Wordpress plugin flaw after PoC exploit released
description: If you use the WordPress Advanced Custom Fields plugin, heads up.

title: Introducing Baseline: a unified view of stable web features
description: MDN is committed to providing modern web development documentation to over a million developers daily. Due to the rapidly-evolving nature of the web platform, and the tremendous innovation happening in the browser space, developers have a hard time keeping up with the constantly evolving landscape and they lack a common language to talk about the features that are generally available for use on the web. To address these issues, Mozilla has engaged in a two-fold approach.

title: Microsoft reminds Windows 10 21H2 users about imminent end of service... and forced upgrades
description: This is the end, my only friend, the end

title: Microsoft wants Firefox to make Bing its default search engine
description: According to a report by The Information, Microsoft wants to bid to make Bing Firefox's default search engine. The browser's contract with Google is set to expire this year, at which point Mozilla could either renew it or switch to a different search engine.

title: Passkeys may not be for you, but they are safe and easy—here’s why
description: If they're so safe and easy, why are there 100s of more comments on an article that essentially tries to quell those fears and questions?

title: Safari retakes second place in global browser market share, but Edge is close behind
description: Last year, Microsoft Edge surpassed Safari as the second most popular desktop browser. Now, new data from Statcounter shows that Apple’s browser has finally regained second place. However, it will have to make an effort to retain this position, as Microsoft Edge is literally in its back.

title: The Safest Way To Hide Your API Keys When Using React
description: Want to make sure your API keys are safe and sound when working with React? Jessica Joseph’s got you covered! She will show you the best ways to hide your API keys, from using environment variables to building your own back-end proxy server.

title: Wind is main source of UK electricity for first time
description: Welp, seeing as how wind not blowing and the sun not shining is a recent development, maybe you should join the research teams trying desperately to make sure those never happen again.
